intro: Ivesia multifoliolata, commonly known as the many-leaved ivesia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rosaceae family, which includes roses and other shrubs. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are often divided into numerous small leaflets. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. Ivesia multifoliolata is typically found in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
